client_profile: A couple looking to buy a property in Brussels with a budget of 490,000â€“895,000 EUR. Priorities include cafes & brunch, restaurants, and central access for an expat-friendly lifestyle.
red_flags: High final purchase costs exceeding budget
Limited property availability in preferred areas
Noise from busy streets or nightlife
Long commute times from certain districts
contradictions: Choosing central access may limit budget options
Desiring cafes may conflict with family-friendly areas
Preference for modern amenities versus historic charm
Expats may find fewer options in upscale districts

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Has vibrant cafes around Flagey Square, ideal for brunch gatherings.
Excellent public transport options via multiple tram and bus stops.
watch_out: Beware of higher prices in trendy micro-areas and noise at night.

top_districts.name: Saint-Gilles
why: Offers diverse dining options, especially around Parvis de Saint-Gilles.
Strong expat community provides a welcoming environment for newcomers.
watch_out: The district can have high rental demand, impacting property availability.

top_districts.name: Uccle
why: Known for its beautiful parks like Parc du Wolvendael for family outings.
Highly rated schools and green spaces suitable for families.
watch_out: Longer commutes to central business areas may be a concern.

real_estate_sites.name: Habitat
real_estate_sites.note: Focus on residential real estate options.

questions_for_agent_landlord: What are the total upfront costs including fees and deposits?
Are utilities included in the lease agreement?
What are the lease termination terms and conditions?
How are noise regulations enforced in the building?
Is there an escalation clause for rent increases?
next_steps: Check local market trends and pricing
clarifying_questions: What specific areas are you most interested in?
Are there any deal-breakers for the housing type?
Do you have a timeline for moving?
action_plan: Confirm your top-3 areas by visiting 2 micro-anchors in each (day + evening).
Confirm full purchase budget: taxes, notary, agency fees, renovation buffer, and monthly charges.
Line up a trusted notary/agent and define your offer terms (conditions, timeline, financing).
Ask the agent/landlord the 5 essentials below and request written answers.
